Browfiler Class Reference

A class for fetching Browfiles from and inserting Browfiles into the application-wide sqlite managed object context. More...

#import <Browfiler.h>

Detailed Description

A class for fetching Browfiles from and inserting Browfiles into the application-wide sqlite managed object context.

Member Function Documentation

+ (NSArray *) allBrowfilesBuiltinLogTo: (NSMutableString*)  log  

Returns an NSArray of all available browfiles of extoreMedia 'builtin' for the current Mac user.

The array consists of the results from +[self allBrowfilesForLocalAppsBuiltInLogTo:] followed by results from +[self allBrowfilesForWebAppsBuiltInLogTo:].

Parameters:
log A mutable string to which log information will be appended, or nil if log information is not desired
Returns:
The array of browfiles, or an empty array if no qualified browfiles were found.

+ (NSArray *) allBrowfilesForLocalAppsBuiltInLogTo: (NSMutableString*)  log  

Returns an NSArray of all browfiles whose external sources are locally-running (i.e. "desktop" or "laptop") applications whose installed version numbers are supported by this application, and owning bookmarks available in the current Mac user's account.

Parameters:
log A mutable string to which log information will be appended, or nil if log information is not desired
Returns:
The array of browfiles, or an empty array if no qualified browfiles were found.

+ (NSArray *) allBrowfilesForWebAppBuiltInExformat: (NSString*)  exformat
logTo: (NSMutableString*)  log 

Returns an NSArray of all browfiles matching a given extore, which must be a web application, and for which a keychain item is available in the current Mac user's Keychain.  In other words, one for each account in a given web application.

The results are sorted alphabetically.

Parameters:
exformat 
log A mutable string to which log information will be appended, or nil if log information is not desired
Returns:
The array of browfiles, or an empty array if no qualified browfiles were found.

+ (NSArray *) allBrowfilesForWebAppsBuiltinLogTo: (NSMutableString*)  log  

Returns an NSArray of all browfiles whose external sources are web applications with a keychain item available in the Keychain of the current Mac user's account.

Within each web application, the profile names are sorted alphabetically in the results.

Parameters:
log A mutable string to which log information will be appended, or nil if log information is not desired
Returns:
The array of browfiles, or an empty array if no qualified browfiles were found.

+ (Browfile *) browfileBuiltinWithExformat: (NSString*)  exformat
profileName: (NSString*)  profileName 

Fetches, or optionally creates if none found, a browfile with extoreMedia type 'built in' from the application's shared sqlite managed object context, with a given exformat and profileName.

The fetch is done first. If a browfile matching the given parameters is not found in the receiver's managed object context, creates and inserts a new browfile and sets its attributes to match the given parameters.

Parameters:
exformat 
profileName The target profileName, or nil for the default/no profile.
Returns:
The fetched or newly-inserted browfile

+ (Browfile *) browfileWithIdentifier: (NSString*)  identifier  

Fetches, or optionally creates if none found, a browfile from the application's shared sqlite managed object context, with a given identifier.

The fetch is done first. If a browfile matching the given parameters is not found in the receiver's managed object context, creates and inserts a new browfile and sets its attributes to match the given parameters.

Parameters:
identifier The identifier that is required of the result
Returns:
The fetched or newly-inserted browfile

+ (Browfile *) browfileWithParts: (NSDictionary*)  parts  

Fetches, or optionally creates if none found, a browfile from the application's shared sqlite managed object context, with given parts.

The fetch is done first. If a browfile matching the given parameters is not found in the receiver's managed object context, creates and inserts a new browfile and sets its attributes to match the given parameters.

Returns:
A dictionary containing constKeyIdentifierXXXX key/value pair(s)

The fetched or newly-inserted browfile

+ (Browfile *) browfileWithStandaloneFileData: (NSData*)  data
type: (NSString*)  type
path: (NSString*)  path
error_p: (NSError**)  error_p 

Fetches, or optionally creates if none found, a browfile from the application's shared sqlite managed object context, which can probably ixternalize given data from a give file type at a given path.

The fetch is done first. If a browfile matching the given parameters is not found in the receiver's managed object context, creates and inserts a new browfile and sets its attributes to match the given parameters.

Parameters:
data The data from the file proposed to be internalized
type The 'type' of the file proposed to be internalized. In this context, 'type' is, for example, one of the document types listed in Target > Info > Properties > Document Types > Name
path The path of the file proposed to be internalized
error_p If a pointer to an NSError* is provided, and a File Manager error occurs, the pointer will point to the File Manager's NSError* upon return.
Returns:
The fetched or newly-inserted browfile
